title: Ticket #1653: Make gridmanager detection of gram version more cautious
description: The gridmanager's detection of a gram server's version needs to be more cautious. Concluding that a gt2 server is gt5 can have disastrous results. If the gridmanager is unsure of a server's version, it should proceed as if it's gt2. If the version later turns out to be gt5, the gridmanager can transition appropriately. Also, Igor Sfiligoi has requested a way to disable gram version detection entirely.
remarks:
2010-Sep-14 14:42:09 by jfrey:
Pushed commit to master for 7.5.4.

2010-Sep-14 14:43:20 by jfrey:
Disabling of gram version detection is done via config param GRAM_VERSION_DETECTION. The default is true. If set to false, then the gridamnager trusts the gram version in the GridResource attribute of jobs.
